description:
Okajima Rokuro - now known almost exclusively as 'Rock' - was once a typical, put-upon Japanese businessman. Then, on a routine business trip, he was kidnapped and ransomed by the Lagoon Company: a band of mercenary pirates operating out of the crime-riddled city of Roanapur. Abandoned by his bosses, he joined the Lagoon Company. Now he must try and stay afloat amongst the ever-shifting politics of the criminal underworld, while simultaneously avoiding death at the hands of his quick-tempered, gun-toting co-worker, 'Two Hand' Revy.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: ブラックラグーン The Second Barrage

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Triads
tags.description: Centered around Chinese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Noir
tags.description: Stylized as a cynical crime drama with low-key visuals.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

name.native: クロード・“トーチ”・ウィーバー

node.description:
[Website](http://www.din.or.jp/~redbear/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroerei)

He is known as Red Bear from TEX-MEX when doing doujinshi.
Senior vocalist for the music group I'VE SOUND.
Singing in English come to her naturally, despite her nationality.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/136171134)

A long-serving anime producer, as well as a founder of [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/), [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) and [Studio M2](https://anilist.co/studio/6137/). He currently serves as the Chairman of the Board at [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Maruyama graduated from Hosei University in 1963, and soon after, he found work at [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/) in 1965. It was here that he met many of Madhouse's future staff members. In October 1972, he left Mushi Production together with [Rintarou](https://anilist.co/staff/102305/), [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Yoshiaki Kawajiri](https://anilist.co/staff/100812/) and founded Madhouse. From that time onward, Maruyama focused mainly on producing and planning Madhouse's upcoming projects. He also served as the studio's president through the '80s and '90s.

Thanks in large part to his frequent attendance at anime conventions, he has become well-known in America among Madhouse's fanbase. Not simply wanting to emulate past successes, Maruyama frequently says at these events that his goal as a producer is to seek out new challenges that will allow the production staff to keep experimenting. This attitude in part has been the reason why he has encouraged the studio to take on projects that may not seem like sure-fire commercial hits. In addition, Maruyama has long been a supporter of bringing new talents into the animation business, and continues to encourage young people to work in anime.

In 2011, he left Madhouse and founded Mappa. Later in 2016, he left Mappa and founded Studio M2.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/87896126)

While studying at Nihon University, Katabuchi participated in the writing team of [Sherlock Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/1972/), which's production also involved [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/). After graduating, he joined [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/).

In 1999, Katabuchi joined [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), where he directed [Princess Arete](https://anilist.co/anime/1028/). The movie was released in 2001 and won Excellent Works of the Year in the Domestic Feature Film Category at Tokyo International Anime Fair in 2002. He joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) and worked for various animations including [Black Lagoon](https://anilist.co/anime/889/). In 2016, Katabuchi directed [In This Corner of the World](https://anilist.co/anime/15227/) which was released on November 12, 2016 in Japan, and planned to be released in fifteen countries including UK, France, Germany, Mexico and US.

Married to fellow director [Chie Uratani](https://anilist.co/staff/121177/).

Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky was a Russian composer of the romantic period, whose works are among the most popular music in the classical repertoire. He was the first Russian composer whose music made a lasting impression internationally, bolstered by his appearances as a guest conductor in Europe and the United States.

Originating from Studio Boomerang, currently affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/). 

His role as a main animator on [Ikki Tousen: Dragon Destiny](https://anilist.co/anime/1956/) attracted a lot of attention. At ufotable he is one of the studio's key members among people like [Akira Matsushima](https://anilist.co/staff/119808/), [Masayuki Kunihiro](https://anilist.co/staff/146702/) and [Masaru Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/146698/).

Held in high regard by [Yasuomi Umetsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101583/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦谷千恵) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chie_Uratani)

Married to fellow director [Sunao Katabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/103947/).
